repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Privatization
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Privatization Technical
            Assistance Project in Bosnia and Herzegovina were as
            follows: outcomes were unsatisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            moderately unsatisfactory, and the Borrower performance was
            unsatisfactory. Lessons learned included: 1) The project
            design could have been improved by broader discussions with
            and involvement of key parliamentary figures; 2) Strong
            government commitment is essential in carrying out what can
            be politically sensitive changes; 3) Technical assistance
            projects of this kind have a greater chance of success if
            they complement policy-based operations and the leverage
            that these provide; 4) Legislation central to successful
            project implementation, particularly in regard to technical
            assistance projects where the Bank has limited leverage,
            should be in place before project implementation begins; and
            5) The presence of the task manager in the field facilitates
            smooth project implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Privatization
            Technical Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Privatization Technical Assistance
            Project will help accelerate large scale privatization,
            through the tender sale of state-owned enterprises, and,
            help prepare the legal, and regulatory frameworks, required
            for divestiture operations. The components call for: 1)
            tender privatization, to assist the Government in the sale
            of state-owned enterprises (not undergoing special
            privatization programs) to strategic local, and foreign
            investors. Emphasis will be given to transferring majority
            ownership of public enterprise assets, into private
            ownership; 2) finance, and advice provision on utility
            privatization under special privatization programs, which
            includes both, the preparation of legislation, and
            regulatory framework for the divestiture of utility
            companies, as well as the actual sale of companies to
            strategic investors; 3) technical assistance with unbundling
            concessions, and insolvency procedures, to be provided to
            large enterprises, and holding companies, including the
            preparatory steps to attract potential investors for the
            separated entities. Private sector participation will be
            ensured through concession agreements, and, affected
            enterprises will be protected under insolvency legislation,
            and accelerated procedures; and, 4) capital markets
            development, by assisting Government Entities, and the
            Securities Commissions in facilitating the completion of
            voucher privatization, creating regulatory frameworks
            required for trading, and revision of securities, and
            formulating stock exchange legislation, commercial codes and
            bankruptcy laws. In addition to the four components, the
            project aims at strengthening institutional building, and
            administrative capacity for project implementation.
